I'm running xp sp2 and it worked with PowerISO 3.8. It says it's an HFS+ image (which makes sense) which might be why it's not working with a bunch of the other programs out there. Just putting that out there.

HI, I was wondering if someone can tell me how to unzip and where to install them after? thanx in advance.

If you try to burn this image I don't think your PC will recognize the disk. This is an Apple HFS+ image so evidently it was meant for use with a Mac computer. PC users should just mount the iso file with PowerISO (or MagicISO), copy the contents to your hard drive and burn a data disk of the copied files instead. It's pretty simple. Thanks, sotis.

SO i have the files, ow do i get the all into my list of font (i know its C:/WINDOWS/fonts) but do i really drag em all there? there are HEAPS

Download and install this:
http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/4658622/FontExpert_2009_Version_10_Release_1

Click "Tools" and then "Find Fonts".  It will show all fonts on your selected drives.  
Select all fonts, right click, and choose "Add all items to worklist.
Click close and go back to the main program.  From here you can scroll down the list of fonts and either use 'delete' or right click and install the font.   If you use the 'Install..." option you can choose to move the selected font to the windows font directory or install it from where it is.
I found FontExpert very useful, went from 2266 fonts down to 811.
This isn't Adobe FontFolio. It has the original RELEASE FONTS in it. The rest is garbage. No actual program, guys. Sorry.
